oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1958-09-20 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from September 20, 1958. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Roy Acuff (host/performer) with his Smoky Mountain Boys (including Howdy Forrester, June Webb, Bashful Brother Oswald, and Jimmy Riddle), guest performers the Browns, and regular performers the Jordanaires, and Minnie Pearl. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 989th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Jordanaires; Browns; Howdy Forrester; June Webb; Jimmy Riddle; Minnie Pearl
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys -- Once More (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Roy Acuff) -- Roy Acuff introduces the Jordanaires -- Dip Your Fingers In Some Water (Jordanaires) -- Roy Acuff introduces the Browns -- Would You Care (Browns) -- Prince Albert commercial (Roy Acuff, Bashful Brother Oswald) -- Roy Acuff introduces Howdy Forrester -- Katy Hill (Howdy Forrester fiddle) -- Roy Acuff introduces June Webb -- My Friendly Enemy (June Webb) -- Roy Acuff introduces Jimmy Riddle -- Down Home Rag (Jimmy Riddle harmonica) -- Roy Acuff introduces Minnie Pearl -- Comedy routine (Minnie Pearl) [continued in part 2]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); United States.
